docs.snippet: Erskine, a Brooklyn Dodgers pitcher, wanted to see Johnny Wilson, a great athlete often met with rejection, properly honored in his hometown....
docs.lead_paragraph: Erskine, a Brooklyn Dodgers pitcher, wanted to see Johnny Wilson, a great athlete often met with rejection, properly honored in his hometown.
docs.abstract: Former Brooklyn Dodgers pitcher Carl Erskine helps raise money for sculpture at Anderson High School in Indiana depicting Johnny Wilson, talented all-around athlete who was often met with rejection because he is black; Erskine and Wilson have been friends since meeting as children, and were bound from that point by their love of sports.

headline.main: Carl Erskine Helps Honor a Childhood Friend

docs.snippet: Even with a tether to the rich and powerful N.B.A., attendance and television viewership have lagged for the W.N.B.A....
docs.lead_paragraph: Even with a tether to the rich and powerful N.B.A., attendance and television viewership have lagged for the W.N.B.A.
docs.abstract: WNBA struggles to remain viable after 20 years, adding to expanding debate about place of women's sports in society; league's attendance fell to average of 7,318 per game in 2015, almost two decades after reaching its peak of 10,864 in 1998.

headline.main: After Two Decades, W.N.B.A. Still Struggling for Relevance
headline.print_headline: Growing Pains Trail W.N.B.A. Into 20th Year
